quote.text: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, he said unto his disciples,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Ye know that after two days is the feast of the passover, and the Son of man is betrayed to be crucified.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then assembled together the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders of the people, unto the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And consulted that they might take Jesus by subtilty, and kill him.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But they said, Not on the feast day, lest there be an uproar among the people.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: There came unto him a woman having an alabaster box of very precious ointment, and poured it on his head, as he sat at meat.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But when his disciples saw it, they had indignation, saying, To what purpose is this waste?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: For this ointment might have been sold for much, and given to the poor.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: When Jesus understood it, he said unto them, Why trouble ye the woman? for she hath wrought a good work upon me.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: For ye have the poor always with you; but me ye have not always.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: For in that she hath poured this ointment on my body, she did it for my burial.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Verily I say unto you, Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world, there shall also this, that this woman hath done, be told for a memorial of her.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went unto the chief priests,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And said unto them, What will ye give me, and I will deliver him unto you? And they covenanted with him for thirty pieces of silver.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And from that time he sought opportunity to betray him.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Now the first day of the feast of unleavened bread the disciples came to Jesus, saying unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare for thee to eat the passover?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And he said, Go into the city to such a man, and say unto him, The Master saith, My time is at hand; I will keep the passover at thy house with my disciples.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And the disciples did as Jesus had appointed them; and they made ready the passover.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Now when the even was come, he sat down with the twelve.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And as they did eat, he said, Verily I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And they were exceeding sorrowful, and began every one of them to say unto him, Lord, is it I?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And he answered and said, He that dippeth his hand with me in the dish, the same shall betray me.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: The Son of man goeth as it is written of him: but woe unto that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed! it had been good for that man if he had not been born.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then Judas, which betrayed him, answered and said, Master, is it I? He said unto him, Thou hast said.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And as they were eating, Jesus took bread, and blessed it, and brake it, and gave it to the disciples, and said, Take, eat; this is my body.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and gave it to them, saying, Drink ye all of it;
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: For this is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many for the remission of sins.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But I say unto you, I will not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father's kingdom.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And when they had sung an hymn, they went out into the mount of Olives.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then saith Jesus unto them, All ye shall be offended because of me this night: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But after I am risen again, I will go before you into Galilee.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Peter answered and said unto him, Though all men shall be offended because of thee, yet will I never be offended.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, That this night, before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Peter said unto him, Though I should die with thee, yet will I not deny thee. Likewise also said all the disciples.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then cometh Jesus with them unto a place called Gethsemane, and saith unto the disciples, Sit ye here, while I go and pray yonder.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and very heavy.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then saith he unto them, My soul is exceeding sorrowful, even unto death: tarry ye here, and watch with me.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And he went a little farther, and fell on his face, and prayed, saying, O my Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass from me: nevertheless not as I will, but as thou wilt.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And he cometh unto the disciples, and findeth them asleep, and saith unto Peter, What, could ye not watch with me one hour?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: He went away again the second time, and prayed, saying, O my Father, if this cup may not pass away from me, except I drink it, thy will be done.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And he came and found them asleep again: for their eyes were heavy.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And he left them, and went away again, and prayed the third time, saying the same words.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then cometh he to his disciples, and saith unto them, Sleep on now, and take your rest: behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Rise, let us be going: behold, he is at hand that doth betray me.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And while he yet spake, lo, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and elders of the people.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Now he that betrayed him gave them a sign, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that same is he: hold him fast.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And forthwith he came to Jesus, and said, Hail, master; and kissed him.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And Jesus said unto him, Friend, wherefore art thou come? Then came they, and laid hands on Jesus and took him.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And, behold, one of them which were with Jesus stretched out his hand, and drew his sword, and struck a servant of the high priest's, and smote off his ear.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then said Jesus unto him, Put up again thy sword into his place: for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Thinkest thou that I cannot now pray to my Father, and he shall presently give me more than twelve legions of angels?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But how then shall the scriptures be fulfilled, that thus it must be?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: In that same hour said Jesus to the multitudes, Are ye come out as against a thief with swords and staves for to take me? I sat daily with you teaching in the temple, and ye laid no hold on me.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But all this was done, that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled. Then all the disciples forsook him, and fled.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And they that had laid hold on Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But Peter followed him afar off unto the high priest's palace, and went in, and sat with the servants, to see the end.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Now the chief priests, and elders, and all the council, sought false witness against Jesus, to put him to death;
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But found none: yea, though many false witnesses came, yet found they none. At the last came two false witnesses,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And said, This fellow said, I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And the high priest arose, and said unto him, Answerest thou nothing? what is it which these witness against thee?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But Jesus held his peace, And the high priest answered and said unto him, I adjure thee by the living God, that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ, the Son of God.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Jesus saith unto him, Thou hast said: nevertheless I say unto you, Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power, and coming in the clouds of heaven.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then the high priest rent his clothes, saying, He hath spoken blasphemy; what further need have we of witnesses? behold, now ye have heard his blasphemy.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: What think ye? They answered and said, He is guilty of death.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then did they spit in his face, and buffeted him; and others smote him with the palms of their hands,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Saying, Prophesy unto us, thou Christ, Who is he that smote thee?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Now Peter sat without in the palace: and a damsel came unto him, saying, Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But he denied before them all, saying, I know not what thou sayest.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And when he was gone out into the porch, another maid saw him, and said unto them that were there, This fellow was also with Jesus of Nazareth.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And again he denied with an oath, I do not know the man.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And after a while came unto him they that stood by, and said to Peter, Surely thou also art one of them; for thy speech bewrayeth thee.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then began he to curse and to swear, saying, I know not the man. And immediately the cock crew.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And Peter remembered the word of Jesus, which said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice. And he went out, and wept bitterly.
quote.author: Matthew
